alert.note: Alert for Henry; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rockingham, southwestern Pittsylvania and Henry Counties and the City of Martinsville through 915 PM EDT... At 846 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Horse Pasture, or near Spencer, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Spencer... Axton... Ridgeway... Leatherwood... Dry Fork... and Villa Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central North Carolina...and south central, central, southwestern and west central Virginia.
